name: OCEAN OPPORTUNITY TEE
description:
MENS SIZING / WOMEN'S SIZING / PRODUCT DETAILS

FREE SHIPPING NOW - MARCH 1st

Print My Threads is excited about the release of our latest desgin for our newest partnering non-profit Ocean Opportunity.  The purchase of each tee supports ocean exploration and its resulting research, innovation, and outreach which will bring us Oceans of Opportunity for this and future generations.

The Ocean Opportunity graphic is hand screen printed using eco-friendly water based inks onto Anvil's super soft  Sustainable Tee.  Feel great in this super soft shirt - knowing that 30% of each sale helps the actions of Ocean Opportunity.

Print My Threads is now taking orders for a limited time. To further minimize waste, all orders for this limited edition tee will be custom printed, packed and shipped after the sale ends on March 1st. 

Order yours today and invite others to wear their love & support of the ocean.

To learn more about Ocean Opportunity and their efforts - visit any of the following links:

WEBSITE / BLOG / PRESS

name: GHANDI HANDS - Cinder/Turquoise
description:
SIZE CHART / PRODUCT INFO

Find yourself wearing this shirt - while losing yourself in the service of others... This fresh new design from Print My Threads features one of our favorite Ghandi quotes. Our Ghandi shirt is hand screen printed on American Apparel's super soft 100% organic cotton unisex tee using eco-friendly, water-based ink. You'll feel great wearing this super soft tee - and you'll also feel good since 1% of each sale benefits environmental organizations across the Planet.

name: LOVE YOUR MOTHER - Purple/Purple
description:
SIZE CHART / PRODUCT INFO

Love Your Mother... and the Earth in this fresh new design from Print My Threads! This timeless Art Nouveau graphic is hand screen printed on American Apparel's super soft 100% organic cotton women's tee using eco-friendly, water-based ink. You'll feel great wearing this super soft tee - and you'll also feel good since 1% of each sale benefits environmental organizations across the Planet.

name: OCEAN RIVER TEE - Charcoal/Aqua
description:
MENS SIZE CHART / WOMEN'S SIZE CHART / PRODUCT DETAILS

FREE SHIPPING NOW - FEB. 4th

Print My Threads is excited about the release of our latest desgin - the Ocean River Tee.  Wear your love for the ocean in this limited edition dolphin inspired graphic tee that supports The Ocean River Institute in their efforts to protect & clean our oceans and rivers.

“Kyle Robinson has created a timeless iconic design that will inspire and honor individuals who care for wildlife, ecosystems and the planet. A limited edition, there will be no by-catch in the printing of this shirt.”

- Rob Moir, the Ocean River Institute

Print My Threads's latest design was inspired by Oceanus - the ocean river that encircles the known world, and by the plight of dolphins suffering from both - the excessive human waste of nitrogen and phosphorus nutrients into waterways, and the horrifying dolphin drive hunting documented by the film, The Cove.

This ocean-river graphic is hand screen printed using eco-friendly water based inks onto Anvil's super soft  Sustainable Tee

Your Purchase of the Ocean River Tee helps green the planet and blue our waters by:

  1. Lessening dependence on oil & petroleum based fertilizers
  2. Curbing discards, thereby prolonging landfill life and reducing toxic emissions from incinerators
  3. Promoting new recycling streams for polyester and plastic bottles
  4. Lessening air, water and soil contamination
  5. Rewarding farmers making the switch from conventional to organic cotton

Feel great in this super soft shirt - knowing that 30% of each sale helps the actions of The Ocean River Institute.

Print My Threads is now taking orders for a limited time. To further minimize waste, all orders for this limited edition Ocean River Tee will be custom printed only once in time for the Valentine's Day.  Order yours today and invite others to wear their love of the ocean.

To learn more about the Ocean River Institute, visit their website: www.OceanRiver.org
